    About Me

    I am a Leverhume-Peierls fellow in the Centre for Theoretical Physics in Oxford, and before that was a postdoctoral fellow in the Theoretical Physics Department at CERN. I received my PhD from the MIT Center for Theoretical Physics in 2020. I am interested in heavy-ion collisions, particularly in data-driven inference using jets, and in far-from-equilibrium dynamics of QCD.

    You can download my CV here.

    Professional Experience
